diskUtilities

Class DiskUnit

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws exceptions.NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit whose name is given. If successful, it makes the particular disk unit available for operations suitable for a disk unit.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the disk unit to activate.
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object.
        Throws:
        exceptions.NonExistingDiskException - whenever no ¨disk¨ with the specified name is found.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws exceptions.ExistingDiskException,
                                  exceptions.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        exceptions.ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        exceptions.InvalidParameterException - for parameters of any type but string.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws exceptions.ExistingDiskException,
                                  exceptions.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - is the number of blocks in the new disk.
        blockSize - represents the size per block in the new disk.
        Throws:
        exceptions.ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        exceptions.InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications.

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  diskUtilities.VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException,
                  exceptions.InvalidBlockException
        Writes the content of block b into the disk block corresponding to blockNum; that is, whatever is the actual content of the disk block corresponding to the specified block number (blockNum) is changed to (or overwritten by) that of b in the current disk instance.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - is the number of a specific block of the disk.
        b - represents the data that will be written on the disk.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException - for a blockNum of zero (block 0 can't be written) or lower, or a blockNum higher than the capacity of the disk.
        exceptions.InvalidBlockException - when the given VirtualDiskBlock parameter is null or if block instance does not match the block size of the current disk instance.

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 diskUtilities.VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException,
                 exceptions.InvalidBlockException
        Reads a given block from the disk. The content of the specified disk block (identified by its number – blockNum) is copied as the new content of the current instance of block being referenced by parameter b.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - is the number of a specific block of the disk.
        b - represents the data that will be read from the disk.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException - for a blockNum lower than zero, or equal/higher than the capacity of the disk.
        exceptions.InvalidBlockException - when the given VirtualDiskBlock parameter is null or if block instance does not match the block size of the current disk instance.

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Method to get the blockSize value.
        Returns:
        blockSize instance variable.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Method to get the disk's capacity value.
        Returns:
        capacity instance variable.

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Formats the disk. This operation visits every “physical block”, except block 0, in the disk and fills with zeroes all those blocks.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Simulates shutting-off the disk. Just closes the corresponding RAF.
